bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The Speaker of the Legislative Assembly is appointed, and subject to this Act
          continues to act as a special commissioner to investigate, inquire into and, if considered
          advisable, make recommendations to the Legislative Assembly respecting the usages,
          customs, practices and procedures of the Legislative Assembly, the rules, Standing Orders
          and the conduct of business of the Legislative Assembly, the Parliaments of the United
          Kingdom and of Canada and other legislative bodies the Speaker considers
          advisable.

Without limiting subsection (1), the Speaker may investigate, inquire
          into and make recommendations respecting any or all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: public access to and attendance at the Legislative Assembly;

broadcast by radio or television of proceedings of the Legislative Assembly and
            its committees;

recording and reporting of debates and proceedings of the Legislative Assembly
            and its committees;

use of closed circuit television or sound systems to relay proceedings of the
            Legislative Assembly and its committees;

a review of the Standing Orders of the Legislative Assembly relating to the
            following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the days and hours of sittings of the Legislative Assembly;
an oral question period and the rules respecting it;

private members' privileges, including private members' bills and
              motions;

standing committees of the Legislative Assembly, and their duties and
              responsibilities;

special committees of the Legislative Assembly to carry out special inquiries,
              functions and duties and the rules of those committees;
publication of the orders and decisions of the Speaker;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the accommodations of the Legislative Assembly and its committees including the
            following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
accommodations and staff for committees of the Legislative
              Assembly;
library and research facilities for the members;

restaurant and lounge facilities during sessions of the Legislative Assembly
              for the members, their constituents and guests;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the provision of officers and staff of the Legislative Assembly and
            accommodations for them;

conduct of the members of the Legislature in the Legislative Assembly and its
            committees and the privileges of members;

other matters the Speaker may consider advisable to inquire into respecting the
            conduct and government of the Legislative Assembly.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The Speaker may appoint persons, including members of the Legislative Assembly, as
          the Speaker considers advisable to advise or assist the Speaker in carrying out powers and
          duties under this Act.

The persons appointed, whether acting alone or as members of a committee, have the
          duties specified by the Speaker.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The Speaker or a person appointed under section 2 may carry on the duties and
        functions under this Act both during and between sessions of the Legislative
        Assembly.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person appointed under section 2 must be paid a reasonable allowance for each
          day during which the person is carrying out duties under this Act as certified and
          approved by the Speaker.

The Speaker and persons appointed under section 2 must be paid necessary and
          reasonable travelling and living expenses incurred in carrying out their duties under this
          Act on approval of the expenses by the Comptroller General.

bcl:text.#text:
Despite the , the Speaker, or a
          member of the Legislative Assembly appointed under section 2, may accept the payments
          provided under subsections (1) and (2), and acceptance of the payments does not make that
          person ineligible as a member of the Legislature or disqualify that person to sit and vote
          in the Legislative Assembly.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The Speaker may employ counsel, clerks, reporters and employees required to carry
        out the Speaker's powers and duties under this Act.

The Speaker or a person appointed under section 2, whether acting alone or as a
        member of a committee,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
has the powers of a select standing committee of the Legislative Assembly, and the
          usages and customs of the Legislative Assembly and the Standing Orders of it that apply to
          a select standing committee apply to the person or committee, and

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The Speaker must report the progress of investigations and inquiries under this Act
        to the Legislative Assembly within 15 days of the commencement of each session together with
        the Speaker's recommendations.

Money required for the purposes of this Act must be paid from the consolidated
        revenue fund, with money authorized by act of the Legislature to be paid and
        applied.
